recognition service it is fully managed and continuously trained and is powered
by deep learning models in the backend the whole point of Amazon transcribe is to give you the developer a really easy
way to integrate speech to text capabilities into your applications we do the heavy lifting we do all the
training in the backend you don't have to worry about that at AWS we like to
think about AI and machine learning in three layers right at the first layer
what you'll see our frameworks if you have existing workloads this is the
place you want to be playing in the second layer is where you might want to be in if you want to build train or even

at this very top player transcribe' has a few popular use cases among many you
might be using it to do media subtitling you might use it to in this case
transcribe audio from contact centers and then pump it downstream to do real-time text analytics or even batch

case whereby you want to have lawyers annotate depositions in real time or you
might have a video game use case where you want to support users who may have accessibility issues meaning they might

and was on transcribe was launched in April 2018 when we first started out we still things like punctuation and
capitalization word-level time-stamping word level confidence scores we also
supported custom vocabularies to help you to be able to recognize specialty words jargon technical terminology and
at the time when we first launched we supported us English and us Spanish since then we've added new features very
exciting new ones many tackling some of the tough challenges here in the science space with regard to speech one is speaker
identification and that's exactly as it sounds being I being able to identify who is speaking saying what and when
we've also added something called channel identification which is the ability to take multi-channel audio run
transcription on each separate channel and then produce an output of a single
transcript that is coherence and allows you put to put that conversation back together and this is especially
pertinent to Amazon Connect as you can imagine there's a caller on one channel and there's an agent on the other
channel and having this feature is very very useful since then we've also launched as
supported new languages British English Australian English as well as Canadian
French and finally last Monday we shipped our brand new feature called
transcription streaming transcription and what that is is a real-time
transcription capability streaming transcription runs over an HTTP 2
protocol you can open a bi-directional stream you pass to our service and audio stream in real-time and we send back to
you a text stream in real-time here are
some of the features of streaming transcription we support us English today we also enable custom vocabularies
of course we have punctuation capitalization at the same time we allow for multiple concurrent connections

confidence scores and we support 16-bit linear PCM we also have this feature
